edu.brown.cs.gk16

Class Trie

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.brown.cs.gk16.Trie

  • public class Trie
extends Object
    The implementation of a Trie which is an ordered tree data structure used to store a dynamic set with the keys being strings.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Trie()
      Each Trie maintains a root which doesn't store any string, its size (the size is the number of words stored in the Trie - not the number of nodes), and a list of all the full words stored in the trie.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNode(String word)
      Adds a word to the Trie by recursively searching the subtree (recurseSubTree helper function) - at each new depth, compares the next letter (left to right) of the word which depends on charIndex.
      boolean contains(String word)
      Returns a boolean detailing if the trie contains the given word.
      List<String> findChildren(String prefix)
      Returns all the possible completed words (as a list of strings) that exist in the trie given a prefix.
      List<String> getWords() 
      TrieNode root() 
      TrieNode search(String word)
      Searches for the node that contains the given word.
      int size() 
      String toString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Trie

        public Trie()
        Each Trie maintains a root which doesn't store any string, its size (the size is the number of words stored in the Trie - not the number of nodes), and a list of all the full words stored in the trie.

    • Method Detail

      • addNode

        public void addNode(String word)
        Adds a word to the Trie by recursively searching the subtree (recurseSubTree helper function) - at each new depth, compares the next letter (left to right) of the word which depends on charIndex.
        Parameters:
        word - word to be added to the trie

      • contains

        public boolean contains(String word)
        Returns a boolean detailing if the trie contains the given word.
        Parameters:
        word - word to be searched for in the trie
        Returns:
        true if word is in the tree, false otherwise

      • search

        public TrieNode search(String word)
        Searches for the node that contains the given word. If the word is a prefix instead of a complete word, the function will return the node that contains the prefix. If the word is not in the trie, the function returns null.
        Parameters:
        word - word to be searched for in the trie
        Returns:
        TrieNode containing the word if it's in the tree, null otherwise

      • findChildren

        public List<String> findChildren(String prefix)
        Returns all the possible completed words (as a list of strings) that exist in the trie given a prefix. First searches for the prefix node using search and then uses the addChildren helper to recurse down the tree looking for children that are completed words.
        Parameters:
        prefix - prefix to completed words to be returned
        Returns:
        list of strings that represent the possible completions of the prefix

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns:
        the size of the Trie

      • root

        public TrieNode root()
        Returns:
        the root of the Trie

      • getWords

        public List<String> getWords()
        Returns:
        the arraylist containing all the words stored in the trie

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
